caption: Food was average, a bit too salty and overcooked. Definitely not the top of the line place. Not the place where I would make a reservation for special occasion. Wine selection was good though.

Great place for a work lunch, especially when it's warm out and you can sit on the patio. The sweet potato tots are an absolute must! We always get several orders for the table because they go so quickly. As for entrees, I'm a big fan of the various salads with salmon; the presentation is nice and it's sufficiently filling and delicious. The lamb burger is also very juicy and tasty.
Decent and quiet outdoor seating.

Quite possibly the worst Valentines Day dinner my fiancée and I have ever had. Steak was undercooked, under seasoned, and full of fat; the soup was cold; the drinks were overpriced; and the service was atrocious. Add that with the plain, pop-up style decor and cheap looking kitchenware, and you’ve surely got a night to remember, but not in a good way. I’m not one to typically complain, but this was next-level bad. We cut our night short in order to go home and ease our stomachaches. We won’t be going back.

A nice choice for having Modern American taste foods within a nice environment. This restaurant is loved much because of it's amazing spices. Some of their popular dishes are Lobster Roll, Clam Chowder, Artbar Burger, Eggs Benedict, Caesar Salad etc.
Good service
Nice space and atmosphere right along the Charles River great views.
Great place for Christmas brunch!

It's a decent size place. The atmosphere is nice. The service was amazing, the food was incredible. I had the garden salad with salmon  it was the best dinner salad I've had in a long time.  They also have a vegan menu you just have to ask for it. Looking forward to going again.
Top notch service food was good.
Nice place terrable service you make reservations and have others seated before you! Really whats the point?!
Great, friendly staff.   Only tried vegan menu which was good. Flatbread and beyond burger was great!

I had a soup here and I have to say it was delicious. The staff is very friendly. My partner has a nut allergy and they were able to make sure all the food  was clear of nuts. Very nice drinks and cocktails too. Quite, warm atmosphere perfect for any dining occasion :) really enjoyed it

I ordered a gluten free meal (allergy) and it was a disaster. The waiter completely messed up my order and did not inform any of the cooks that I ordered a gluten free meal. I had to walk around feeling sick for the rest of the day.
Good food very respectful service
Great meals, city prices. Portions are reasonable to generous.

Beautiful view and the menu looks good but we couldn’t try any food/drink. This restaurant has the WORSE SERVICE ever! When I arrived there with my friends, there was no hostess by the door, so we decided to sit by ourselves. We were 3 people waiting for more 2, so we chose a big table. A waiter came to us asking if we were having dinner, we said yes. After about 20 minutes waiting, the manager came to us asking again if we were having dinner. I said : yes! We are! Can we finally order ? Then he said that we couldn’t sit there because that table was for 7 people. IThe problem is that at that time there were no more available tables in the restaurant any more! He stared at me and my friends and didn’t give us any option. It was so rude and I felt so uncomfortable that I immediately left the restaurant . I don’t recommend this place.
Beautiful view, breakfast was good 👌
Quality apps
Best restaurant/bar in the hotel!!
The lamb burger here is excellent.
Quiet patio bar overlooking the Charles River. Very chill place.
Delicious and great service.
(Translated by Google) Great with live music.  (Original) Toll mit Livemusik.
Crab sandwiches
Nice view
Good food and out door seating

I came here during Boston restaurant week with my gfs. We all got the caesar salad to start, I got the scallops for entree and my gfs got the salmon. The caesar salad was standard, nothing special. The scallops on the other hand was a bit more interesting and delicious. It was paired with mashed corn. It gives the scallops a hint of sweetness. My friends thought the salmon was good but not amazing. Restaurant is located inside the hotel. It was super cold inside, recommend wearing layers. My friends and I, and everyone else had to keep their jacket on during our meal. This was very uncomfortable.
Don't know how to staff a restaurant or prepare for groups.

Caring staff, indoor bar and seating, outdoors bar and seating with a fantastic view of the Boston Skyline- I recommend after dark for this purpose. A little pricy if you don't order a burger, but worth it either way.

Horrible! My friend and I ate outside. It took forever to get service. Order drinks before the food wrong move. It took her at least 15 min to bring the drinks. Ordered food dont even go there with hiw long it took to get the food. Had to go look for her to pay the check. Never again.
Breakfasts are good :)
Chill, amazing view and the dishes they serve is unique.

(Translated by Google) Very welcoming and modern. An outdoor space that inspires on the delightful canal. It is the bar of the Royal Sonesta hotel also open to those who do not stay. Elegant but not pretentious. Prices in line with Boston  (Original) Molto accogliente e moderno.  Uno spazio esterno che suscita sulla canale delizioso.  È il bar dell hotel Royal Sonesta aperto anche a chi non soggiorna. Elegante ma non pretenzioso. Prezzi in linea con Boston
First time there.  Excellent service.  Great food!  Amazing Clam Chowder!  Very helpful.
Wonderful place
I really liked it but the server took a while to get us a seat even though we had a reservation. Decent view at night! And fairly priced!

The ArtBar in the Sonesta Hotel (Cambridge) is a delightful location on the Charles River. The patio is a great place for lunch or dinner on a pleasant summer or fall evening. The    creative cuisine and service are excellent.

The food was just alright but pretty overpriced and the service while polite was very very slow. They didn't bring some of the items we asked for and we had to flag them down to get a refill of waters after waiting with empty cups for 10-15 minutes.  I would come back here for a drink and the view but skip the food next time.

We went to a late dinner on a Thursday night and the service was absolutely terrible. One waiter for the entire inside dining area. We received our beverages and waited about 20 min to see the waiter again. Our appetizers were served, we ate, and then our plates were not cleared until our entrees arrived. After waiting about 30 minuets for our meals two of the meals were served while myself and my friend waited 15 additional minutes for our entrees to be served. It wasn’t until we have been sitting for over an hour and half for the manger came over to tell us the situation. The food was delicious and our server Paul was amazing with custom service considering he was waiting on the entire inside dining. However, for a late Thursday night there is no need to be in a restaurant for over 2 hours for an appetizer and dinner.
Great atmosphere and variety of choices! Very fresh food!
Decent food

Menu looks good but we couldn’t test it. We were seated at a table and brought water, after which no one came up for about 20 minutes so we left. I’m assuming every staff member thought we were someone else’s job. Very poor teamwork and customer service on their part.
Waited for 15 minutes after being seated. Left.
Food is great. Prices are wonderful...the view!

The staff and waiter(Paul)  we had were great.  One of the kids in our group can not eat peanuts,  and desert that came with the kids meal was made in a peanut facility.  The waiter and the manager( Cheryl,  I think)  when out of  their way to find a desert that the kid could eat.  They didn't have to do this but it was very appreciated.  The food was very good too.

Burger was out of this world delicious! Buffalo chicken dip was AWFUL and no heat whatsoever! I personally make a dip myself and this one tasted days old. Service was random as the bartender was super overwhelmed with patrons while trying to close early. Asking for a napkin took several minutes, which was after I had to ask for utensils. If in the area or staying at the hotel I would visit this location only if in a pinch or for drinks.  Plenty of restaurants in Cambridge stocked properly with fresh ingredients and utensils.
Great scenery.
Poor service: I had to seat myself and I waited for ever to get the menu. Small menu and not very appealing. I don't recommend this place!!!
Beautiful views of the Charles river.
Nice food. Nice staff. Nice view. I mean, what else? Bit pricey but worth it!
It might look nice but they got my order wrong. Food was horrible. The waiter wasn’t very good either. If you have kids this is not the place for you. Overall just not a good place to go
Food is great, everyone in my party was totally satisfied.  If you sit outside you'll have a beautiful view of the Boston skyline, especially nice in the nighttime.
Great food, great location, great service
Great atmosphere and location. I prefer starters here.
Very good in every respect and superb in terms of location during sunset
Gorgeous view and fine service. Drinks are amazingly tasty and creatively presented. Totally recommended.
Nice spot
A very so so party with a great location

We were here for July 4th and it was the worst service and food. Seemed fine at first. However it went downhill fast. We didn’t receive 2/3 of our children’s food. Our waiter never brought the things we asked for. Something simple like water and ketchup. We had to get vocal to get any help. We still walked out without receiving our food. Don’t go. It’s a waste of your time and money. We never got to see a manager.
Nice view and drinks, but poor food options and quality.
Awesome outside eating experience. Great view of the water and downtown. Enjoyed the service and food.

My sweet daughter spent her hard earned money to take 5 of us out to dinner here. May I say that the food could have been enjoyed more if the chairs weren't terribly uncomfortable? Limited menu. Some entrees have accompanying potato or vegetable, others only have the plain protein.  We even ordered dessert which varied widely from the way it was described. Mine was supposed to be raspberry sorbet. It came with 3 tiny scoops of sorbet - none raspberry, and 4-5 pieces of gummy previously frozen fruit! Ugh. Won't be back.

Best location looking over the Charles River,  delicious cocktails and apps. We had yucca fries, potato nachos and the best app, IMHO, the flat bread pizza with pulled pork. Staff was wonderful. I'll be using this location for a business event in a few months and feel confident it will be a big hit with our group.

We made a reservation, but when we arrived, no one was there to seat us. We had to look for someone to do so. An employee named Kevin assisted us. His customer service was wonderful. Our waiter was Angel and he was nice as well. The food was just alright. Nothing to brag about. I had the vegan burger.

Stopped by while waiting for our duck boat tour because we saw online they had outdoor seating. There were people sitting outside when we go there and eating...when we went inside to get seated they said the outdoor patio doesn’t open until noon. Also on their menu it says fresh squeezed orange juice, and when we ordered it that way, the server said it isn’t fresh squeezed and is made from a can. Food was just ok. We would have gone somewhere else but was short on time. Plenty of other options around to check out instead.
Great breakfast but not so much for business discussions. No real privacy but nice outside seating as we can't the views are fantastic.
Friendly staff and great food. The fruit bowl is good.
Lovely patio area and great brunch menu. Fabulous for a leisurely meal
Gorgeous location, great art in the walls, and great food. Add professional and friendly staff and you get a phenomenal location fir lunch!
Great location
Beautiful setting out on the patio. Unfortunately, my white wine is way too old and maderized. At $15 for the glass, that does not cut it.
Great tater tots. Solid lunch option if you're in the hotel or the attached office building.
Best date night spot with outdoor view of Boston-Cambridge by far
A nice place for a casual outing
There is a lot going on at the hotel this place is inside of. In the midst of it, this restaurant is an oasis of chill. The food is really good and the staff professional.
(Translated by Google) Great service and quality of food! Shrimps are a delight!  (Original) Super service et qualité des plats ! Les crevettes sont un délice !

Don't waste your money. Below average food. We could've stayed another night at our hotel for what we paid for 4 drinks, 2 apps and lobster rolls. Clam chowder was less flavorful than what you can get at the supermarket.

The bar itself is quite clean and elegant. The food is on the average side. I'd like to mention that I went for breakfast. Maybe the dinner menu is abit better. The prices are average to high for a breakfast plate. The service was well. I wouldnt go back, I'd prefer to explore other options around the hotel. (Its located in a hotel, for those of you that didn't know that.)

We stayed at the hotel that the restaurant was connected to and everything from lunch to dinner was delicious. The lobster roll was amazing and it was one of the best I have ever had in Boston. Brunch was also good and the menu is extensive for everyone.
The food is like a 7 out of 10. Not bad but not great. The server is amazing.  Food came out a lito slow for me and food was warm but not  hot enough for me
Not many vegetarian options
As far as hotel bars go, this was quite good.

I had not breakfast and dinner here. The breakfast was a very expensive buffet, with not much to it. It was fancy, but very expensive  The dinner was great! Drinks were good, did was very delicious. One if my friends got a burger that looked amazing.
Nice breakfast, good service.
Food is subpar. Staff is friendly though.
Good place to eat.
Not for me
This place is ok for what it is but I have never had a great time there. Hotel is good.
Good food, great location!

Cannot wait to return! We were in town visiting and it happened to be Dine Out Boston week so we came here since it had vegetarian options for my companion. I had the most perfectly cooked scallops I think I've ever had. The entire dish was amazing and I think about it every time I think of Boston. The charred octopus appetizer was good too but I thought the carrot puree was a misfit.

The 3 of us went out for Thxgvg dinner. Expected 'okay', but got 'terrific' !  Waitstaff very friendly, a little pressed due to big holiday crowd, but checked on us etc.  Drinks great.  We ordered the special Thxgvg Dinner option.  Soup fantastic.  Dinner served 'home style' > bowls, baskets & platter of turkey dinner items brought to table !  Really felt more 'homey', like our own family dinner. Absolutely everything was just great !  Straightforward good tasty traditional food.  Gravy great too.  Dessert table insane; you go pick.  Great choices. Coffee good too. Expensive but worth it !!  We will go back again. PS, Very family friendly. Liked seeing cute kids around. Also liked seeing customer diversity. / Clean restroom. 😉
Interesting cocktails and delicious lamb burgers

If you are looking to pay 2.5x$ for bland cold food, then this is the place for you.... We joked about how full our salt and pepper containers were, it's because you'll use it all. With only 3 other customers you would think our service would be fast and food would be hot, neither were true.

Nice and cozy place to go out for drinks. Its located at the ground floor of a hotel and has a nice view to Boston from windows if you happen to sit near. The service is great, their cocktails are very nice. I had Moscow Mule and loved it! I would suggest you to go here if you are looking for a nice and peaceful environment.
Go when the weather is nice

My husband and I paid $74 for two unseasoned/disgustingly bland Lobster Omelettes and lightly peppered potatoes.  If your eyes lit up when you saw the omelettes on the menu, bring your own bag of seasoning. It was an amateur Meal at an expensive price.
The food is here is very, very good... The meals are not cheap but you are paying for high quality food. I had the duck confit and seasonal flat bread... Both of which were exceptional!

Awful service, waiters and hostess are lost, they don’t understand what they’re supposed to do be doing. We ordered a continental breakfast, but a lot of items were out and they didn’t replace it. Food is terrible. I don’t recommend it!
We had a work dinner there and it was fantastic. The execution was flawless. Staff was super helpful and accommodating. Everyone was very pleased.

Stopped in for some Sunday morning brunch, place was not even 1/3 full. I waited 15 min to only receive some water, slowest service Ever! I would not recommend this place unless you want to wait all day to receive your food / drinks.

Wonderful experience/location/ambience, delicious food as well! Stefani was such a welcoming hostess who shared her top suggestions and was such a pleasure to talk to!! Top customer service, will return!!
Wings were good. Portions small for high prices. My caesar salad was gross.
Nice patio, with pretty view on the river and Boston downtown. We just had cocktail and fried calamari. All was good
Moscow mule served in an steel cup instead of copper. Chicken wings were good and that's about it.took an hour for our check to arrive.  This shouldn't be a 5 star restaurant.
Fast service, great food!
Great out door cafe restaurants,  with courageous view on the river.

Perfect moment! We had a great time for my birthday! The service was perfect, the plates were beautiful and the food was delicious! Lot of finesse like a real gastronomic french restaurant. I will certainly come back again for another season when the menu will change.
Food is average.
Good food, great cocktails, awesome atmosphere, and the chocolate marquise is to die for
A+ dining, great views.
Wonderful enviromment!!! Delicious hor d'ouvres!!!
Good food and nice service
Solid brunch, improved by a gorgeous setting. Service was slow, but might just be that particular waiter.

The food was mediocre at best.  I had the scallops and the sauce/aioli was pretty much a big dollop of mayo.  The sides were raw carrots and everything on the menu was way overpriced.  The drinks and view here seem to be the only good thing about this place.  Nice bar and view of water and drinks were creative and tasty.
We ate breakfast there.  Delicious food and wait staff were able to cater to a gluten free diet request.
Fantastic view of the Charles River in Cambridge. Try their delicious hot olive bread. Lively crowd. Good service.
They didnt honor our reservation.
Ambience was fabulous.   Waitress couldn't have been just.   Food was good,  a little pricey.

Food could have been better. Service was exceptional. Ambience and views are perfect. Can get really noisy at times. But courteous staff and Charles River by the side make up for it. The zing was missing from food but portioning was humble. Felt Caesar salad was bland, grilled salmon had that fishy smell though perfectly cooked (skin was crispy and core was pink), dessert was a let down for a pastry with figs. Too sweet and creamy.
We had a splendid time!
Lobster roll

The scenery is great, but food is okay at best. The lamb burger I had was not very tender and could have been better seasoned. However, the fries were good. The Moscow Mule that I had to drink did not have the right ratio of ginger beer to lime and vodka. I would say it is good to eat here once, but I'm not sure about recurring trips.
Okay food. Overpriced.
Great drinks and vibe
Limited menu but the food is pretty good. Go with the lamb burger or crab cake sandwich.

Used to be one of my favorite places in Boston, this time outdoors was closed for no clear reason, food was overly greasy. Asked for no cheese on corn arrived with tons of dressing, solution was simply removing them. Such a shame really for a great location and what used to be a great place
Nice beachfront view, great food and drinks menu variety. Nice and clean and friendly staff.
Great food. Nice view if the city.

Great place to sit down and have brunch. Make sure to call ahead and make a reservation. Larger parties (more than ten people) should plan ahead and bring cash to settle the bill. Our server for this experience was phenomenal, even to the point of tolerating and satisfactorily serving a growing party. Food was also very good.
Good food. Veg options available.
Im a big fan of the lobster roll with tater totts. The views are amazing if you sit outside.

Great place by the river, nice wait staff, indoor and seating (more outdoor than in) wait was 40 min to eat outside and instant to eat inside .  The wings are a must try!   Burgers we're good but we asked for medium and both were served well done so keep in mind when ordering.   The presentation of food very nice and dessert was a fancy version of traditional servings.... Enjoyed and wpuwo definitely eat there again!
Great place, nice view
Good food, great outlook on Boston skyline
Good ambience.
Service was a little slow but overall good. Dirty tots was so delicious. Sweet potato tots with a mild spicy kick. Reccomend ordering it. Drinks were super strong. Beautiful location. Nice patio.
Good location. Service was ok but good for after dinner drinks
Great view
Food was fine, nice area.

The location is beautiful and the food was pretty good. I only gave it 4 stars because it was the 4th of July and the cook was super busy. Maybe they could have had someone else help cook? I had to send my food back because I ordered a burger with extra cheese and grilled onions. They forgot the extra cheese and the onions were raw even though I emphasized grilled. However the problem was corrected promptly.

This restaurant and bar has been completely remodeled. It has a brighter look and an inviting vibe. When seated in the back section for breakfast, you can be overlooked by the waitstaff. Request the front seating area.
The place has a wonderful patio and some indoor seating. I requested my burger be medium rear, i got it well done and very greasy. There is a good choice of drinks.
Great coffee. Signature affle donuts were dense and chewy if you like that sort of thing....
Good food but pricey and not for big appetites. Specialty burgers are good and affordable though. They also have Lamb burgers that are also reasonably priced.
Food was ok, neat view.
Cool place little pricey on the food but worth it considering the beautiful view of the water and the city
Excellent place to eat
Great outdoor seating with views of Boston, live music for Sunday brunch
Service was terrible - took forever to get our order.
Interesting food and fun atmosphere on the patio with a river and city view.
Wow! Excellent venue and menu.

Attended The Latest Reinvention of this location and I was amazed. The food was amazing. The staff is very friendly and attentive! The views are absolutely beautiful. A perfect location for a summer outside event, with great food and cocktails! You wont be disappointed!
Very nice atmosphere (inside and outside) and although we just went for dessert, it was delicious. Service was pretty good. A bit loud inside. Would definitely return.
Am Host was very friendly
Nice hotel place great view of river
Nice place

Reserved a table ahead of time, but still had to wait 45 minutes to sit outside. Food is good, but overpriced. You're really paying for the location, so don't bother if you have to sit inside (no river view).
I could live on sweet potato tots.
Food was okay but service was terrible! A lot of food came out cold, only reason to come is if you can get a table on the patio.

The food was OK but didn't feel substantially better than average pub grub. The crab cake sandwich was very disappointing with the crab cake itself tasted like flour and there wasn't much crab. The chowder, tots and the desert were good.

Place looked nice and clean. The type of restaurant where you don't leave smelling like food, which is always a plus. Not too packed and on the quieter side.  The food was a bit plain and was pretty expensive. You're essentially paying for the view instead of the food.
We were surprised to have a lovely lunch here.  It was unusually quiet on a wintry day. The roast chicken and the pear dessert were delicious.

I’m In Boston alone on Thanksgiving, met twice ladies while walking who recommended their place for the Thanksgiving dinner. $50 for all you can eat, food looked good, but I was not in the mood for turkey. So I sat at the bar. Was served by Ato, who when I asked what drink was his best to make, told me the Espresso Martini. So I had the and a lobster roll with sweet potato tater tots (Ato’s suggestion). I was not disappointed. The Martini was delicious. And the food as well. Ato’s service was stellar and he was working smoothly with his team and always checked on me.
Great food with great service and view!

Very nice and modern looking place. Pretty upscale dining, lobster roll was great. Asparagus side was great. DO NOT ORDER FISH TACOS. Very oily and undercooked. Soda was flat. Dining ware was made of plastic. Doesn't look too professional in my opinion. Service was great, very attentive. Not my #1 place to dine out al fresco, surely #7.
The food was amazing but it is a little overpriced
The food was good, but the service was slow. The clam chowder had no flavor whatsoever. Just needed a place for breakfast near the mall, but it was definitely not worth the price.
Good food nice view
The location and the food were outstanding.  The service was slow and practically nonexistent.  Long wait times.
Great food, nice staff. Serves breakfast, lunch, and dinner.

We sat here Friday night, the place was a bit empty, drinks and food were overpriced and the quality was below par. The wine was bad (spoiled). the service was bad and the drinks were served in plastic cups.
Has outside seating and great view. Great food and kind service. We'll come again
Nice atmosphere. Food is ok.
Terrible service we had a reservation and were told it didn't matter. Would never come back.

I was at Royal Sonesta for a conference. I went to eat at Artbar April 29th. I had the worst service. Got my drink after after waiting 20 minutes and threatening to leave! Food was okay. I gave it another shot and went on may 2nd. Received excellent service from Elisa and the fish tacos were to die for! I guess the server can make or break a restaurant!!
Stopped by for brunch. Great food, great prices, attentive staff! Would love to come back again

We were here on the morning of Valentines Day for brunch because we were basically snowed in and didn't really feel the need to make any special plans. Arrived and the host was not at the stand so it took them a minute to seat us which was fine.. The server was very courteous and took our order fairly quickly. That's about where the high point of the experience ends. It took them nearly 45 minutes to bring us our food: clam chowder, loaded tots, breakfast sandwich, and lobster benedict. Server and another attendant brought out EVERYTHING at once and had the gall to bring us two bowls of clam chowder that very evidently had been sitting in the cold for way too long. The soup had a thick crust on top of it exactly like when you leave a sauce or soup sitting around for a few moments - unsurprisngly it was lukewarm on the cusp of cold. The tots were actually not bad but again, not very warm. My lobster hollandaise which was a $20 entree was actually cold to the touch so the sauce, eggs, and butter on the lobster were basically inedible. Initially I thought this was the error of the kitchen because our server was so nice - then I took a look around the place which to be clear, was not busy due to the snowmageddon situation, and eventually concluded that everyone was given their food in a timely professional fashion while our server clearly just did not do the service properly. My expectations at hotel restaurants generally aren't high but even at a dumpy diner I have never had someone hand me a bowl of soup with a crust on top of it. I politely told our server that our food was cold and truth be told, I didn't want to wait another 45 minutes for them to redo our order to they "generously" took 20% off our ticket, it should be noted that our server mentioned this us and a manager did not come to check on us at any point. The whole time we were dining we then were privileged enough to watch their bartender very loudly try and give astrophysics lessons to a poor older couple seated at the bar while the 2 or 3 servers, including ours, stood next to him chit chatting. I'd extend my complaints to the food but to be frank, the food was so cold and gross that I can't tell if the food was bad or if the temperature just made it terrible.
I ate in the Art Bar for breakfast and a dinner.  The quality of the food was excellent however, the service was indifferent at best.
Had lunch on Christmas day, very friendly environment, good service and food!

The only redeeming quality of this "restaurant" is its location. It's not edgy or even remotely worth the effort. The food and drinks are over priced. Eat somewhere else. I can't believe that this is Zagat rated.
Nice location and good service. Ideal for a drink and bite.

The food is great and seasonally themed. We came in early November, and many of the dishes featured squash and raisins in one way or another. I enjoyed the salmon and the risotto, and the roasted parsnip soup was especially good. We asked for the autumn salad to be made vegetarian for us, and although it was brought out with bacon, our waiter was quick to change it for us when we pointed it out.
They were kinda busy at lunch, and got our orders mixed up. Food was hotel quality, so not bad, not fantastic. Definitely good for a busy lunch.

Amazing waterfront location with good food, it is a little pricey. Sit outside during the warmer months and enjoy the view of the charles. Extremely convenient if you are staying at the Royal Sonesta as well.
Chicken and Waffles with apricots were the perfect! Coupled with an expansive view of the Charles, this place ideal for getting together with friends or a date.

ArtBar is a nice, small, indoor/outdoor bar that's more set up for dinner than casual drinks. There is an outdoor bar and a couple of high top tables to hang out at, but a lot more of the outdoor space is for sit down dining. Food was decent though. Drink list was a bit short however. Good view of the West side of Boston.
Nice view.  Not so great selection of Beers.
The food is really good and the view of the terrace is amazing! Nice cocktails too!
Wait staff was friendly and inviting, area was quiet and pretty. Food was delightful and the presentation matched.
A very welcome surprise that a hotel bar can be so nice. Location is fantastic
Very nice food and lovely outdoor space for the summer.
Not worth it. Food is over priced and not really that good.
We had a really good brunch here. Service was very good. A little pricey, but worth it for a special treat.
Good menu. Excellent service
Neat place to experience fireside outdoors. Great view of Boston. Helpful staff who provided us with blankets when it got colder.
Excellent breakfast
Slowest service ever! Does anyone work here???????
Went during restaurant week in Boston. The food was great but the service was a bit lacking. Drink refills were slow and overall attention was less than ideal.
Awesome restaurant, very pleasant dinner, had the chicken with lemon yogurt sauce, splendid! Ceasar salad was also good and great and friendly waiters. I'm pleasantly surprised :)
Went here for the restaurant week dinner special. Food was interesting - black bean soup; finger potatoes, heirloom carrots, chicken; vanilla cream dessert. All great choices.
I stay at the hotel a lot for convenient locatio to work. This restaurant is my go to for dinner and/or drinks. Service is great when its not too busy, but patio is their hidden secret.
I tried a few things but I always come back for the Burger. Just their burger. Nothing else you can get a salad or fries and it has bacon on it.

The service here is pretty poor, but the food is OK. From our vantage it seemed that the floor manager wasn't really on top of things, so it's hard to blame the staff when it's a problem further up the chain.  I wouldn't really recommend this place unless you can't find anywhere else.
Diverse lunch spot on the Sonesta ground floor (go inside the hotel and go left). Works for business or meet-up drinks. Varied menu.
The outdoor area facing the river is great! Good to go for a cocktail or dessert
was there for the first time and they made me feel like family
Patio is very nice. Service mediocre.  Meals over-priced.  Valet parking is $18. This place does not live up to it's pricing.

This place is hit or miss, but missing more often than hitting. We visited with a party of  10 and sat outside on a gorgeous Spring day. On the few occasions our server stopped at the table, she would only take partial orders and then leave the table without returning for 15-20 minutes. The remainder of the order was then placed, and the entire order delivered ~ 30 minutes after originally placed. (No exaggeration.) 2 of us uncharacteristically spoke to the manager to no avail. The cocktails that were served were overpriced and low quality. I don't plan on revisiting.

Had the Prix Fixe brunch. Everything we had was quite good, but the peppery smoked salmon might have been the highlight. We opted for wine pairings; the wines were very  nice for by-the-glass offerings, but not necessarily matched particularly well with the specific dishes.

Had a great caesar salad, juicy burger and sweet potato tots at the ArtBar yesterday. Service and food were both A+. The view of the Charles also make this place a gem. I recommend the ArtBar if you find yourself in East Cambridge.

I look forward to giving this another try when the weather is nice; we went during the winter and didn't get to try out the beautiful patio.  I was a little bit obsessed with the fries and sweet potato tots appetizer, because it was served in mini fryer baskets. Adorable. I'm a tater tots FIEND; I really enjoyed the first few bites of these, but I quickly tired of the sweet potato flavor. If you're really into sweet potato, though, you'll probably love these.  We enjoyed our entrees: house-made cavatelli for me and the daily seafood special for Joel (in this case, it was salmon with pomegranate seeds and other tasty things). We were given free desserts (they saw us taking photos of the food and said they wanted to give us something really beautiful for photos). We appreciated the gesture, but we were so painfully full already that we didn't really enjoy them. The chocolate fudge cake was HUGE, reminiscent of the "Great Wall of Chocolate" at PF Chang's.

Did not get any food.  Jared at the bar was fantastic at making off the drink menu beverages!  He made me a gimlet and now I'm a convert. The woman playing piano and singing was really good too, probably moved the rating up one star on her own.
